section.para: This extension to the codeplug allows to set device specific channel settings for many TyT radios (and therefore also many Retevis radios). Not all settings are present in all radios. Unsupported settings are ignored during encoding or set to the default value during decoding.
This extension is applicable to the TyT MD-390, MD-UV380, MD-UV390, MD-2017 and Retevis RT8, RT3S, RT82 radios.

example.title: Example channel settings specifying the default values for TyT/Retevis devices.
example.programlisting: tyt: loneWorker: false autoScan: false talkaround: true dataCallConfirmed: false privateCallConfirmed: false emergencyAlarmConfirmed: false displayPTTId: true rxRefFrequency: Low txRefFrequency: Low tightSquelch: false compressedUDPHeader: false reverseBurst: true killTone: Off inCallCriterion: Always allowInterrupt: false dcdm: false dcdmLeader: false

listitem.para: If true, the lone worker feature is enabled.
If true, the auto-scan feature is enabled.
If true, talk around is enabled. That is, the radio will receive on the input and transmit on the output frequency of the repeater effectively bypassing the repeater.
Enables the confirmation of data, private and emergency calls. These fields are usually disabled as the radio will first establish the connection before the actual call can be started.
If true, the received analog PTT will be shown.
Specifies some weird reference frequency setting for RX and TX. By default the value Low is used. Possible values are Low, Medium and High.

variablelist.title: Channel settings for TyT MD-390 and Retevis RT8

listitem.para: If set to true, the silent squelch is used.
If enabled (default), avoids a noise burst at the end of a transmission, when the squelch is controlled by a sub tone.

variablelist.title: Channel settings for TyT MD-390 and Retevis RT8

listitem.para: Specifies the kill tone. Possible values are Off, Tone259_2Hz and Tone55_2Hz. Disabling or setting the kill tone to 259.2Hz or 55.2Hz, respectively.
Specifies the in-call criterion. Possible values are Always, AdmitCriterion and TXInterrupt.
Enables/disables interrupts if inCallCriterion is set to TXInterrupt.
If enabled, the dual-capacity direct mode is used for simplex operation.
If DCDM is enabled, this flag specifies whether this radio is the channel leader. That is, if this radio provides the clock for the time-slots.
